**Setup:** Geekvape Tsunami 24mm; 7 wrap 24/32awg kanthal claptons @ .32Î©; cotton wicks; 60 W

**Testing:** The Flavor Apprentice - (Crunchy) Berry Cereal @ 6%; Aged: 1 week

**Flavor description:**  Bright and airy berry mix over a grainy, sugary, almost buttery bit of something crunchy hinting at dry cereal.  I wouldn't call it a 1:1 to the actual cereal it mimics, but it is pretty damn close.  This flavor also seems to get pretty intense at higher temps.

**Off-flavors:** Gets a little over-grainy if you go much above 6%, almost like dry cracked corn.

**Throat hit:** 7/10, it's definitely above average for me 

**Uses:** Start around 2-4%, but it seems much above 6% a little of that corn/grain note starts to comes out. This flavor would be ideal in a cereal recipe or even some bakery type mixes.

**Pairings:**   This flavor begs to be paired with something creamy or milky.  A dash or two of your favorite fruit(s) would also help turn it up a notch.  

**Notes:** This isn't a great standalone for me but it does make for a great additive in a recipe. The grainy note tends to be barely noticeable with most dairy/cream additions.
 
Flavor available at BCV [here](http://www.bullcityflavors.com/crunchy-berry-cereal-tfa/) and is listed as "Crunchy Berry Cereal".
